meanings.definition: A type of mineral that is often used in jewelry.
meanings.sent1: The taxite in her necklace sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She admired the beautiful taxite ring on her finger.
meanings.sent3: The taxite gem in the pendant seemed to wink at her playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the taxite stone as if it held a secret.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler explained how rare taxite is and its value in jewelry making.

meanings.definition: To transport or convey using a taxite vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to taxite the employees to the conference in style.
meanings.sent2: They taxited the guests to the event in a luxurious limousine.
meanings.sent3: The idea to taxite everyone in a party bus brought smiles all around.
meanings.sent4: The taxi driver taxited them through the bustling city streets with ease.
meanings.sent5: He taxited the group to the airport, making sure they arrived on time.

meanings.definition: The act of charging a fee or levy on goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The taxite on imported goods was causing prices to rise.
meanings.sent2: The government implemented a new taxite on luxury items.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected taxite on ice cream left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: The taxite on parking spaces made finding a spot even more challenging.
meanings.sent5: Business owners were frustrated with the increasing taxite on their services.
